channel.title: GPU on James Akl
channel.description: Recent content in GPU on James Akl

item.title: CUDA ontology
item.description: CUDA’s terminology carries significant overloading: the word “CUDA” itself refers to at least five distinct concepts, “driver” means different things in different contexts, and version numbers reported by various tools measure different subsystems. This article provides a rigorous ontology of CUDA components: a systematic description of what exists in the CUDA ecosystem, how components relate to each other, their versioning semantics, compatibility rules, and failure modes. Each term is defined precisely to eliminate ambiguity.
